description: Listed building consent in connection with demolition of existing rear extension and installation of glazed doors in enlarged rear opening to former rear extension and replacement glazed doors in existing rear opening at basement level. Removal of security bars to windows. Installation of new satellite dish on rear elevation. Internal alterations including replacement staircase from upper ground floor to lower ground floor, removal of internal walls at lower ground floor level and installation of ceiling panel extraction system and removal of fireplace at second floor level.
decision_conditions: REASON:  The proposed alterations to the rear elevation, by reason of the loss of part of the main rear wall of the house and inappropriate size and design of the glazed infill panel, as well as the inappropriate design of the new rear double doors, would fail to preserve the character and special interest of this listed building, contrary to Unitary Development Plan 2002 policy D39 and to advice in Planning Policy Guidance Note 15: Planning and the Historic Environment and English Heritage's 'London Terrace Houses 1660-1860'.
